data.title: George Washington to Mario Cuomo Bridge
data.meta_description: This is the longest and most awesome NYC eBike tour we offer. Ride along a spectacular winding route through the hills of Westchester.
data.text:
Our Longest Scenic eBike Tour

This is the longest and most epic eBike ride we offer! 65 Miles. You ride up the Hudson River Greenway to the George Washington Bridge. Cross the George Washington Bridge and travel North on NJ Route 9w (Scenic Route) toward the new Tappan Zee (Mario Cuomo) Bridge. On your journey, you ride along the Palisades Cliffs through Interstate Park with breathtaking views of the Hudson River and Westchester County. Up next you ride through Tallman State Park as you get closer to the MC Bridge. On the route, you will pass through the beautiful town of Piermont NY before you arrive at the Bridge. (This new Mario Cuomo Bridge has protected bike lanes that keep the group away from all vehicular traffic) You then cross the Hudson River and ride to the Empire State Trail.

The Empire State Trail runs from the Canadian border, Monreal direction & another section Northwest Niagara Falls direction and runs all the way to NYC. We will be on the portion from Elmsford NY to Van Cortlandt Park in NYC. (about 20 miles) The greenway was constructed mostly along the mainline of the former New York and Putnam Railroad that was retired back in 1958. Its spectacular winding route through the hills of Westchester passes lakes, streams, and a waterfall as you cruise down towards Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. Once at Van Cortlant Park in the Bronx, we will meet up with another Greenway network called “The Bronx River Greenway”. ride on that greenway towards Randall’s Island. Once at Randall’s Island, you ride over the Connector Bridge on the Northern side of the island, under the Amtrak bridge to the Southen side of the island where we will cross the 103rd Street Pedestrian Bridge back into Manhattan.

Route Overview

65 mile ride

75% protected bike lanes/greenways

20% traditional bike lanes

5% shared road with cars/trucks

Tour starts and finishes at our storage facility on 29th Street and 11th Avenue – Manhattan Mini Storage building

Subway #7 Train (Purple Line ) to Hudson Yards 34th street – Exit train and walk to 29th Street and 11th avenue – across the street from 311 11th Avenue or 5 min off the 11th Avenue/Hudson Yards exit walking on the High Line.

Inclusions

Private guided tour

Walie Talkie smart helmet

Important Info
